questions.text: Which of the following is an incorrect match:
questions.correct_answer: D. Lower 2/3 of vagina = Mullerian ducts

questions.text: Which of the following statement is false:

options.label: A
options.text: Vaginal epithelium is stratified squamous non keratinised

options.label: B
options.text: Endocervical epithelium is stratified squamous epithelium

options.label: C
options.text: Urinary bladder epithelium is transitional epithelium

options.label: D
options.text: Ovarian surface epithelium is cuboidal epithelium which is also called germinal epithelium of Waldeyer.

questions.correct_answer: B. Endocervical epithelium is stratified squamous epithelium

questions.text: Assertion: Only one sperm can enter the secondary site Reason: Zona functionalis prevents multiple entries due to zona block

options.label: A
options.text: Assertion is correct and the reason is correct explanation

options.label: B
options.text: Assertion is correct and the reason is incorrect explanation of assertion

options.label: C
options.text: Assertion and reason both are incorrect

options.label: D
options.text: Assertion is incorrect reason is the correct statement but incorrect explanation

questions.correct_answer: B. Assertion is correct and the reason is incorrect explanation of assertion

questions.text: Correct statement is

options.label: A
options.text: Fertilisation occurs most commonly in isthmus

options.label: B
options.text: Morula enters uterus, 6 days after fertilisation

options.label: C
options.text: Implantation occurs most commonly on posterior wall near fundus

options.label: D
options.text: Implantation stage is trilaminar disc stage of zygote

questions.correct_answer: C. Implantation occurs most commonly on posterior wall near fundus

questions.text: True or False: i: Total blood in placenta is 250 ML at term gestation ii: Villous space of placenta has fetal blood iii: Nitabuch’s layer causes morbidly adherent placenta iv: Hofbauer’s cells are fetal cells
The following pathology of placenta is:

A 23 year old primigravida with 36 weeks of gestation came to the emergency room with decreased fetal movements since 2 days, pedal edema and facial puffiness since 2 weeks. Her NST was done and it was found reassuring. Other examination findings were normal. On doing USG obs, it was found that the AFI was 3cm, fetal weight was 7th percentile for the gestational age with uterine artery S/D ratio of 4.2. What should be the plan of action in this case?

options.label: A
options.text: Emergency caesarean section for oligohydramnios and utero placental insufficiency

options.label: B
options.text: Admit, observe till 38 weeks with daily NST and weekly doppler

options.label: C
options.text: Immediate induction of labour after confirming pelvic adequacy

options.label: D
options.text: Reassurance and home monitoring of “daily fetal kick count”

questions.correct_answer: C. Immediate induction of labour after confirming pelvic adequacy

questions.text: Match the following conditions with colour of amniotic fluid:
Umbilical cord originates from

questions.correct_answer: C. Early gestation requiring follow up

questions.text: Incorrect statement about fetal blood:

options.label: A
options.text: Earliest site of erythropoiesis is yolk sac

options.label: C
options.text: Life span of fetal rbc is 110 days

options.label: D
options.text: Fetal blood has high oxygen affinity

questions.correct_answer: C. Life span of fetal rbc is 110 days

questions.text: Vessel connecting fetal circulation to placental circulation:

options.label: A
options.text: Most common presentation of fetus = cephalic

options.label: B

options.label: C

questions.correct_answer: B. Most common malposition of fetus = Breech

questions.text: Which of the following is incorrect?

options.label: A

options.label: C
options.text: Lambdoid suture is in between occipital and parietal bone

options.label: D
options.text: Overlapping and fixed cranial bones would mean grade 4 moulding

questions.correct_answer: D. Overlapping and fixed cranial bones would mean grade 4 moulding

questions.text: 32-year-old Primigravida has come in labour at 38 weeks of gestation. On examination, fetal supraorbital ridge and frontal bones are felt on PV. Cervix is 8 cm dilated and pelvis is adequate. Which of the following is true ?

options.label: B
options.text: Apply forceps when cervix is fully dilated

questions.text: One of the following statement is incorrect

options.label: A
options.text: Precipitate labour gets over in less than 3 hours

options.label: C
options.text: Obstructed labour is most common cause of vesico-vaginal fistula

options.label: D
options.text: Bandl's ring is palpable per abdomen

questions.correct_answer: B. Obstructed labour forms Shroeder's ring

questions.text: Which one of the following statement is true:

options.label: A
options.text: The uterine contractions in labour start from the cornual region which acts as a pacemaker of contractions

options.label: B
options.text: Magnesium sulphate is known to activate contractions

options.label: C
options.text: Uterine tachysystole is when there are 5 contractions in 10 minutes

options.label: D
options.text: Intensity of 15mm of Hg is sufficient in 1st stage of labour

questions.correct_answer: A. The uterine contractions in labour start from the cornual region which acts as a pacemaker of contractions

questions.text: What should be the next line of management for the patient at 35 weeks pregnancy with IUGR and the following doppler finding in umbilical artery:

options.label: B

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: C. Her free B-HCG is normal

A 23 year old G3P2L2 with full term pregnancy, came to labour ward in active labour with cervical dilatation of 8 cm and fetal station at +2 with occiput at 7’o’clock position. Which of the following is true regarding this case:

options.label: A
options.text: This is a case of malpresentation and hence forceps cannot be applied in this case

options.label: B
options.text: If fetus delivers with occiput at 6’o’clock position then it is called face-to-pubis delivery

options.label: C
options.text: Most common cause of face to pubis delivery would be android pelvis

options.label: D
options.text: Most common outcome in a case of malposition is face-to-pubis delivery

questions.correct_answer: B. If fetus delivers with occiput at 6’o’clock position then it is called face-to-pubis delivery

questions.text: As compared to 1st trimester, the 3rd trimester has more chances of all except?

most emetogenic hormone is:

options.label: C
options.text: It occurs earlier in Primigravida than multipara

questions.text: 28 year old pregnant patient with history of 2 abortions, one ectopic pregnancy and one live birth at 7 months of gestation comes with 36 weeks twin pregnancy. Obstetric formula is:

questions.text: A 30 year old female comes with obstructed labour. She is febrile and dehydrated. FHS are absent and presentation is cephalic. What is the line of management?

questions.correct_answer: A. Watch for progress of labour

Which of the following statement is incorrect regarding MTP in INDIA:

options.label: B
options.text: One doctor is needed to certify if MTP is of pregnancy till 20 weeks

options.label: C
options.text: 2 doctors are needed to certify if MTP is of pregnancy beyond 20 weeks

options.label: D
options.text: Medical MTP of first trimester is done by ethacridine lactate method

questions.correct_answer: D. Medical MTP of first trimester is done by ethacridine lactate method

questions.text: Which of the following condition does not warrant APLA testing?

options.label: A
options.text: 3 or more first trimester pregnancy losses

questions.text: A 32 year old patient, Gravida5 PARA (0+0+4+0), has 14 weeks of pregnancy, she has 2cm sized intramural fibroid, her TORCH titre test shows IgG toxoplasma positive. Her cervical length is 3.5 cm, aPTT test is 120 seconds ( Control is 40 seconds). She would require?

options.label: D
options.text: Myomectomy and then aspirin plus heparin

questions.text: A 27 year old patient was undergoing surgery and the following instrument was used during surgery. What is not correct regarding this case?

options.label: A
options.text: History of recurrent pregnancy losses of 2nd trimester

options.label: B
options.text: This instrument is used for doing Shirodkar’s cerclage

options.label: C
options.text: USG is must for assessing cervical length

options.label: D
options.text: Infections and anomalies must be ruled out

questions.correct_answer: C. USG is must for assessing cervical length

questions.text: A 23 year old newly married nulliparous patient has not got her menses since 2-3 months, she had checked her UPT which showed faintly positive line. Her relatives have brought her to emergency room with history of syncopal attack since 3 hours. On examination, her pulse is 108/minute, her BP is 84/52mm Hg, cervical motion tenderness ++, left forniceal fullness++ . Usg is suggestive of free fluid in peritoneum with moving internal echoes. What should be the best modality of management in this case?

options.label: A
options.text: Give crystalloids, blood grouping and cross matching, exploratory laparotomy with salpingectomy

options.label: B
options.text: Give crystalloids, remove peritoneal fluid by culdocentesis.

options.label: D
options.text: Do D and C and send the tissue for histopathology

questions.correct_answer: A. Give crystalloids, blood grouping and cross matching, exploratory laparotomy with salpingectomy

questions.text: A 23 year old patient , G2A1 with 32 weeks of gestation has history of fall from two-wheeler bike. She has got pain in abdomen, decreased fetal movements and bleeding per vaginum since the accident. On examination her pulse is 114/min, BP is 86/54 mm Hg. Uterus is stony hard in consistency with 36 weeks fundal height, BISHOP’s SCORE is 3/13. Fetal heart sounds are present but 96/min persistently. next line of management is?

options.label: A
options.text: Give fluid resuscitation, steroids and tocolytics since she is preterm of 32 weeks

options.label: B
options.text: Give fluid resuscitation, steroids and do ARM and wait for vaginal delivery

options.label: C
options.text: Give fluid resuscitation, steroids , ARM but immediate caesarean section

options.label: D
options.text: Give fluid resuscitation, steroid, ARM and do induction of labour with PGE1 tablet

questions.correct_answer: C. Give fluid resuscitation, steroids , ARM but immediate caesarean section

questions.text: Most common cause of abruptio placenta is :

A 23 year old patient, G2 A1 with 9 months of pregnancy has history of painless bleeding per vaginum 12 hours back. She is not bleeding at present. Her uterus has reached the level of Xiphisternum. There is no tenderness or uterine contractions. FHR is 136 beats per minute found medial to left spino-umbilical line below umbilicus. Pallor is present. Her gestational age is 36 weeks as per usg of 1st trimester. Which of the following statement is incorrect regarding this case?

options.label: B
options.text: We can wait and watch till 37 weeks but blood transfusion is needed for anemia

options.label: C
options.text: Investigation of choice is transvaginal sonography

options.label: D
options.text: Blood transfusion and emergency LSCS is must since it is breech presentation.

questions.correct_answer: D. Blood transfusion and emergency LSCS is must since it is breech presentation.

questions.text: Which of the following is false regarding placenta previa:

options.label: A
options.text: More common in primigravida than multipara

options.label: B
options.text: It increases the risk of post-partum hemorrhage

options.label: D
options.text: Can be managed conservatively till term

questions.correct_answer: A. More common in primigravida than multipara

questions.text: During caesarean section of one patient, it was found that uterus is atonic with profuse blood loss. All the drugs for medical management were tried but bleeding was not getting controlled which of the following is not the right approach in this case?

options.label: D
options.text: Anterior division of internal iliac ligation

questions.text: One of the following clinical scenario is not correct.

options.label: A
options.text: To prevent PPH by active management of third stage of labour, the drug of choice is oxytocin

options.label: B
options.text: Controlled cord traction is to be done by modified Brandt Andrew’s method

options.label: C
options.text: Bimanual uterine massage is used for prevention of PPH

options.label: D
options.text: Delayed cord clamping prevents neonatal anemia

questions.correct_answer: C. Bimanual uterine massage is used for prevention of PPH

questions.text: Not an indication of blood transfusion in pregnancy:
Prevention of anaemia in pregnancy in INDIA is done by

options.label: A
options.text: One IFA pill containing 60 mg elemental iron plus 500 mcg of folic acid daily from 2nd trimester for 180 days in ANC and 180 days post partum

options.label: B
options.text: One IFA pill containing 100 mg elemental iron plus 500 mcg of folic acid daily from 2nd trimester for 180 days in ANC and 180 days post partum

options.label: C
options.text: One IFA pill containing 60 mg elemental iron plus 500 mcg of folic acid daily from 2nd trimester for 100 days in ANC and 180 days post partum

options.label: D
options.text: One IFA pill containing 100 mg elemental iron plus 500 mcg of folic acid daily from 2nd trimester for 100 days in ANC and 180 days post partum

questions.correct_answer: A. One IFA pill containing 60 mg elemental iron plus 500 mcg of folic acid daily from 2nd trimester for 180 days in ANC and 180 days post partum

questions.text: A 39 year old Primigravida is a known case of type 2 diabetes mellitus since 5 years with 18 weeks of gestation has blood sugar levels of F: 132mg%, HbA1C 8.2% . Which of the following is not correct regarding treatment modality?

options.label: A
options.text: Trisomy screening is to be done by Quadruple marker test

options.label: B
options.text: Oral hypoglycemic agents are to be switched to insulin therapy 1IU/kg

options.label: C
options.text: She is explained about high risk of congenital malformations and level 2 scan should be advised

options.label: D
options.text: Maternal insulin can cross placenta and it leads to fetal macrosomia as a complication

questions.correct_answer: D. Maternal insulin can cross placenta and it leads to fetal macrosomia as a complication

questions.text: As per DIPSI criteria, a patient is labelled as a case of G.D.M if:

options.label: A
options.text: 2 hour blood sugar level after 100 gm oral glucose is >=140mg%

options.label: B
options.text: 1 hour blood sugar level after 100 gm oral glucose is >=140mg%

options.label: C
options.text: 2 hour blood sugar level after 75 gm oral glucose is >=140mg%

options.label: D
options.text: 1 hour blood sugar level after 75 gm oral glucose is >=140mg%

questions.correct_answer: C. 2 hour blood sugar level after 75 gm oral glucose is >=140mg%

questions.text: Which of the following is incorrect regarding thyroid disorder in pregnancy?

options.label: A
options.text: Most common cause of thyrotoxicosis is Grave’s disease

options.label: B
options.text: Most common cause of hypothyroidism is iodine deficiency

options.label: C
options.text: Propylthiouracil is the drug of choice in first trimester for hyperthyroidism

options.label: D
options.text: Methimazole can be given from second trimester for hyperthyroidism

questions.correct_answer: B. Most common cause of hypothyroidism is iodine deficiency

questions.text: If delivery occurs unexpectedly while the patient is on Heparin and excessive bleeding occurs, what is the appropriate initial intervention?

options.label: D

questions.text: The most fulminant Viral hepatitis in pregnancy

A 30 year old primigravida has 35 weeks of gestation with twin gestation in cephalo-breech presentation. Her previous 3 ANC visits were uneventful and normal. Now her BP is 146/90 mm Hg, found 2 times 4hours apart. Her 24 hour urine examination shows 350mg albuminuria. She has no other symptoms. Fetal well-being assessment is within normal range. Formulate the plan of action in this case.

options.label: A
options.text: Give anti-hypertensive, continue monitoring and terminate at 37 weeks by induction of labour

options.label: B
options.text: No anti-hypertensive, continue monitoring and terminate at 37 weeks by caesarean section

options.label: C
options.text: No anti-hypertensive, continue monitoring and terminate immediately by induction of labour

options.label: D
options.text: No anti-hypertensive, continue monitoring and terminate at 37 weeks by induction of labour

questions.correct_answer: D. No anti-hypertensive, continue monitoring and terminate at 37 weeks by induction of labour

questions.text: 32 year old G3A2 has 32 weeks of gestation has had convulsion of generalised tonic clonic type. She has been brought in emergency room with post-ictal drowsiness and BP of 160/110mm Hg. Which of the following is true regarding this case?

options.label: A
options.text: MgSO4 acts as anti-convulsant of choice and it also has anti-hypertensive property

options.label: B
options.text: If convulsion does not recur then pregnancy can be continued with MgSO4 cover

options.label: C
options.text: Alpha methyldopa is drug of choice for hypertension

options.label: D
options.text: Ergometrine should be avoided since it is a vasoconstrictor

questions.correct_answer: D. Ergometrine should be avoided since it is a vasoconstrictor

questions.text: Which of the following statement is incorrect:

options.label: B
options.text: D.O.C for chronic hypertension is ALPHAMETHYLDOPA

options.label: C
options.text: D.O.C for MgSO4 toxicity is CALCIUM GLUCONATE

options.label: D
options.text: D.O.C for pre-eclampsia is Sublingual Nifedepine

questions.correct_answer: D. D.O.C for pre-eclampsia is Sublingual Nifedepine

questions.text: A 24 year old primigravida with 30 weeks of gestation came to the emergency room with labour pains with uterine contractions since 4 hours, cervical dilatation of 2 cm with intact membranes. After admitting the patient, which all treatment modalities are to be given to this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Tocolytics, dexamethasone, MgSO4, antibiotics, cervica-vaginal swab for culture.

options.label: B
options.text: Tocolytics, dexamethasone, MgSO4, cervicovaginal swab for culture

options.label: C
options.text: Tocolytics, dexamethasone, cervico vaginal swab for culture

options.label: D
options.text: Tocolytics, MgSO4, cervicovaginal swab for culture

questions.correct_answer: B. Tocolytics, dexamethasone, MgSO4, cervicovaginal swab for culture

questions.text: Which one of the following drug is not used in preterm labour?

27 year old primigravida with 41 weeks 3 days with Single Deepest Pocket score of 1 cm has come for routine ANC check-up. Her USG doppler is normal. NST is reactive. What should be the next plan of action?

options.label: A
options.text: Immediate induction of labour after confirming pelvic adequacy

options.label: B
options.text: Wait and watch for spontaneous labour

options.label: D
options.text: Admit her, wait till completion of 42 weeks and then induce labour

questions.correct_answer: A. Immediate induction of labour after confirming pelvic adequacy

questions.text: Most common type of conjoined twins?
A 23 year old primigravida with 38 weeks of gestation has painless watery vaginal discharge without inflammation with FFN positive. What is your diagnosis?
A G5P4+0+0+4, is 36 week pregnant was admitted to labour ward with preterm labour. She delivered in 2 hours of onset of labour. One of the following is not true regarding this case.

options.label: A
options.text: This patient has had a precipitate labour

options.label: C
options.text: This patient has high chance of PPH

questions.correct_answer: B. This patient has cervical incompetence

questions.text: A 34 year old Primigravida with 35 weeks of gestation has spontaneous rupture of membranes without onset of labour, her pelvis is adequate for vaginal delivery. On examination, there is cephalic presentation. What should be the plan of action in this case?
questions.correct_answer: B. Antibiotics and induction of labour

questions.text: A primigravida has undergone Group B streptococcal screening. Which of the following is incorrect statement?

options.label: A
options.text: It is to be done at 35-37 weeks by rectovaginal swab

options.label: B
options.text: It is for preventing neonatal sepsis

options.label: C
options.text: If it comes out positive then immediate penicillin-G I.v. is given

options.label: D
options.text: If patient is allergic to penicillin then give cefazolin in case where there is no high risk for anaphylaxis

questions.correct_answer: C. If it comes out positive then immediate penicillin-G I.v. is given

questions.text: Which one of the following is incorrect statement regarding growth restricted fetus?

options.label: A
options.text: Most common cause of symmetric IUGR is genetic defect

options.label: B
options.text: Most common IUGR is asymmetric IUGR

options.label: C
options.text: Symmetric IUGR has better prognosis than asymmetric IUGR

options.label: D
options.text: Termination of pregnancy with IUGR and OLIGOHYDRAMNIOS is done at 34 weeks

questions.correct_answer: C. Symmetric IUGR has better prognosis than asymmetric IUGR

questions.text: Q81: ideal time of termination of pregnancy which has asymmetric IUGR with no other clinical and investigational abnormality is:
Which one of the following is not a sign of fetal demise?
When is the ideal time for induction of labour in an uncomplicated pregnancy with past history of fetal demise?
One of the following is a not an indication for induction of labour?
questions.correct_answer: C. Non severe pre-eclampsia at 34 weeks

questions.text: Identify the given procedure?
Para 1 living 1, 27 year old female with Rh negative pregnancy delivered Rh positive baby 7 days back. Her ICT is negative. What is the next line of Management?

options.label: A
options.text: Give injection anti D 300 microgram i.m.

options.label: B
options.text: No need of injection anti-D because three days are over

questions.correct_answer: A. Give injection anti D 300 microgram i.m.

questions.text: A 24 year old G3P2L2 with 32 weeks of gestation is Rh negative. Her partner is Rh positive, ICT is positive with titres of 1/32. What is the next line of management?

options.label: A
options.text: Do USG guided amniocentesis for bilirubin evaluation

options.label: B
options.text: Do USG guided cordocentesis to check foetal Hemoglobin level

options.label: C
options.text: Do USG doppler for MCA-PSV of fetus

options.label: D
options.text: DO weekly ICT till 34 weeks and terminate pregnancy.

questions.correct_answer: C. Do USG doppler for MCA-PSV of fetus

questions.text: Trial of labour in a case of previous cesarean section can be done in one of the following conditions

A 25 year old primigravida is 6 week pregnant, HIV positive. Which of the following things is incorrect regarding the management?

options.label: A
options.text: CD4 count <350 is an indication of ART

options.label: B
options.text: ART of choice is Tenofovir, Lamivudine and Efavirenz

options.label: C
options.text: HIV is not an indication of caesarean section in INDIA

options.label: D
options.text: During labour, ARTIFICIAL RUPTURE OF MEMBRANE is avoided.

questions.correct_answer: A. CD4 count <350 is an indication of ART

questions.text: Which infection is most teratogenic in pregnancy?
As per MOHFW, what is the current recommendation regarding compulsory vaccination in pregnancy?

options.label: A
options.text: 2 doses of TT vaccine, one month apart (only one dose i.e. TT booster is sufficient if the patient is immunised in past 3 years)

options.label: B
options.text: 2 doses of Td vaccine, one month apart (only one dose i.e. Td booster is sufficient if the patient is immunised in past 3 years)

options.label: C
options.text: 2 doses of TT vaccine, one month apart (only one dose i.e. TT booster is sufficient if the patient is immunised in past 5 years)

options.label: D
options.text: 2 doses of Td vaccine, one month apart (only one dose i.e. Td booster is sufficient if the patient is immunised in past 5 years)

questions.correct_answer: B. 2 doses of Td vaccine, one month apart (only one dose i.e. Td booster is sufficient if the patient is immunised in past 3 years)

questions.text: The correct gestational age for assessing the following USG finding between two marked points is?
The following USG finding is seen in twin pregnancy, which of the following is incorrect statement?

options.label: A
options.text: It is seen in dizygotic twins

options.label: B
options.text: It can be seen in monozygotic twins

options.label: C
options.text: This type of twins has best prognosis

options.label: D
options.text: The gender of the babies is always the same

questions.correct_answer: D. The gender of the babies is always the same

questions.text: One of the following is not a cause of oligohydramnios:
Assertion: Oesophageal atresia in fetus causes polyhydramnios. Reason: Drainage of amniotic fluid is blocked by oesophageal atresia.

options.label: A
options.text: Assertion and reason are correct and reason is correct explanation of assertion

options.label: C
options.text: Assertion reason are correct but reason is not the correct explanation of assertion

options.label: D
options.text: Assertion is correct statement reason is incorrect statement

questions.correct_answer: A. Assertion and reason are correct and reason is correct explanation of assertion

questions.text: A 22 year old patient , primigravida with full term pregnancy is undergoing caesarean section for fetal distress. During operation, the uterine artery is injured. Which instrument is best suited to hold the angle of incision?
One of the following is not true regarding the patient who has delivered this baby.

options.label: A
options.text: This is associated with vitamin b9 deficiency

options.label: C
options.text: This condition is associated with shoulder dystocia

options.label: D
options.text: It can be diagnosed earliest on USG by 2nd trimester

questions.correct_answer: D. It can be diagnosed earliest on USG by 2nd trimester

questions.text: A 27 year old primigravida is in labour, her gestation is 37 weeks, her pelvis is adequate. Vertex presentation is seen, station is +2 with occiput at 3-o-clock position with fully dilated cervix and membranes are absent. There is maternal exhaustion and she is not able to bear-down. Which of the following is not correct option?

options.label: A
options.text: Oxytocin is given if contractions are inadequate

questions.correct_answer: C. Simpson’s forceps can be applied

questions.text: One of the following statement is correct regarding instrumental delivery:

options.label: A
options.text: Vacuum should be applied only when cervix is fully dilated

options.label: B
options.text: Forceps can be applied in incompletely dilated cervix

options.label: C
options.text: Forceps can be applied in preterm labour of less than 34 weeks

options.label: D
options.text: Keilland’s forceps are applied when station is +2 or below with occipito anterior position

questions.correct_answer: C. Forceps can be applied in preterm labour of less than 34 weeks

questions.text: Which one of the following conditions presents with absence of both Mullerian and Wolffian structures?
STRUCTURE FROM CAUDAL PART OF MESONEPHRIC TUBULES:
Identify the structure labelled as “D”:
